marketNews.title: Indonesia Coal Exports to China Down 12% YoY in 1H25
marketNews.content: China customs recorded that Indonesia's coal imports in June 2025 fell 30% year-on-year to about 11.6 million tonnes. This result means China imported roughly 91 million tonnes of Indonesian coal during the first half of 2025, down 12% YoY. For context, Indonesian coal exports to China grew modestly in 1Q25 (+1% YoY) before starting an annual decline in 4M25 (-5% YoY). The decline in Chinese imports of Indonesian coal in 1H25 is deeper than imports from other countries, such as Russia (-4% YoY), Mongolia (-4% YoY), and Australia (-1% YoY). Overall, Chinese coal imports in June 2025 dropped to about 33 million tonnes (-26% YoY, -8% MoM), marking the lowest monthly import level since February 2023. This brings total Chinese coal imports in 1H25 down 11% YoY to approximately 221.7 million tonnes. Reuters reported that the downward trend in Indonesian coal imports to China occurs alongside rising domestic coal production in China. In addition, lower global coal prices have made high-calorific-value coal, which yields more energy per tonne, more cost-competitive, thereby pressuring demand for Indonesia's lower-calorific-value coal. The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) noted that Indonesia's coal production since the start of 2025 reached about 390.2 million tonnes as of 22 July 2025, roughly 53% of the 2025 target. Meanwhile, Indonesian coal exports amounted to about 199.2 million tonnes, only about 40% of the 2025 target.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
1. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said on Monday (21 July) that a 19% tariff on Indonesian export goods to the United States could be implemented earlier than the August 1, 2025 deadline set by President Donald Trump. Airlangga noted that the timing depends on a joint statement from both countries, expected soon. Previously, Indonesia and the United States reached a trade agreement last week, reducing the import tariff on Indonesian goods from 32% to 19%.
2. Energy and Mineral Resources Minister and Head of the National Energy Acceleration and Security Task Force Bahlil Lahadalia handed over feasibility pre-study documents for 18 priority downstream projects worth about US$38.6 billion to Danantara on Tuesday (22 July). Bahlil explained that the projects are outside the battery-car ecosystem and include 8 downstream projects in minerals and coal, 2 energy transition projects, 2 energy security projects, 3 agricultural downstream projects, and 3 marine and fisheries downstream projects. Danantara CEO Rosan Roeslani said the documents will be acted upon promptly and the projects are expected to create jobs for more than 270,000 people.
3. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Monday (21 July) that the next US-China negotiations could include discussions on China’s purchases of Russian and Iranian oil. The comment followed President Donald Trump’s warning last week that the United States might impose a 100% secondary tariff on countries trading with Russia if Russia does not reach a peace agreement with Ukraine within 50 days. China is currently the main buyer of Russian and Iranian oil.
4. SKK Migas Chairman Djoko Siswanto said on Monday (21 July) that oil lifting in the first half of 2025 reached 578,000 barrels per day, equal to 95.5% of the 2025 APBN target of 605,000 barrels per day. Natural gas delivery reached 5,483 MMSCFD, equal to 97.4% of the 2025 APBN target of 5,628 MMSCFD.
5. PT Jagat Raya Imajinasi bought approximately 1.2 billion shares of Bank Amar Indonesia (AMAR) at an average price of 119 rupiah per share on 16 July 2025. The transaction value was about 144 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Jagat Raya Imajinasi’s ownership in AMAR increased from zero to 6.58%.

tickerNews.title: Astra International subsidiary to acquire 83.67% of Mega Manunggal Property (MMLP)
tickerNews.content: $MMLP: Astra International ($ASII) announced that its subsidiary, PT Saka Industrial Arjaya, has signed an agreement to acquire 83.67% of Mega Manunggal Property shares from PT Suwarna Arta Mandiri, Bridge Leed Limited, and other minority shareholders. The transaction value was not disclosed. After completion, PT Saka Industrial Arjaya will become the new controlling shareholder of MMLP and will conduct a mandatory tender offer.

tickerNews.title: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi clarifies no IPO plan for PT Intam (CUAN)
tickerNews.content: $CUAN: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company has no plan to launch an IPO for PT Intam, its gold mining subsidiary. The statement came after several national media outlets reported that the company was preparing an IPO for PT Intam. In its clarification, CUAN explained that the company has never been asked for any official comment or confirmation by the media regarding such news.

tickerNews.title: Garuda Indonesia discusses Boeing fleet needs and financing plan (GIAA)
tickerNews.content: $GIAA: Garuda Indonesia, in a clarification to the IDX, said that the company and Boeing are discussing the details of fleet requirements that match the airline’s market share, including delivery timelines. The statement followed recent reports that the airline was planning to purchase 50 Boeing aircraft as part of a trade negotiation with the United States. Garuda explained that the purchase aims to strengthen its fleet and optimize its network over the next five years, and that financing for the aircraft will come from the company’s financial restructuring plan.

tickerNews.title: Vale Indonesia (INCO) announces new South Korean strategic partner for HPAL project
tickerNews.content: $INCO: Acting President Director of Vale Indonesia, Bernardus Irmanto, said that a South Korean company will become a new strategic partner in the HPAL project in Sorowako, South Sulawesi. While he did not name the partner, he mentioned that the Korean firm is currently completing land acquisition and permitting. The current partner in the Sorowako HPAL project is Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt Co. from China.

tickerNews.title: Era Media Sejahtera acquires ~105.5 million DOOH shares, increasing stake to 70.305%
tickerNews.content: $DOOH: The controller of Era Media Sejahtera, PT Prambanan Investasi Sukses, purchased approximately 105.5 million DOOH shares at an average price of 101 rupiah per share on 17 July 2025. The total transaction value was about 10.7 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Prambanan Investasi Sukses’s ownership in DOOH rose from 68.94% to 70.305%.
